articles.author: BASSEM MROUE, KAREEM CHEHAYEB and TIA GOLDENBERG
articles.description: TYRE, Lebanon (AP) — Thousands of Lebanese displaced by the war between Israel and Hezbollah militants returned home on Wednesday as a ceasefire took hold, driving cars stacked with personal belongings and defying warnings from Lebanese and Israeli troops to stay away from some areas.
articles.title: Thousands of Lebanese return to their homes as Israel-Hezbollah ceasefire takes hold

articles.author: JULIA FRANKEL
articles.description: JERUSALEM (AP) — For many across the Middle East, the Israel-Hezbollah ceasefire came as a relief: the first major sign of progress in the region since war began more than a year ago.
articles.title: The Israel-Hezbollah ceasefire quiets one front but Gaza sees no end to war

articles.author: JILL COLVIN and ALANNA DURKIN RICHER
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — A number of President-elect Donald Trump 's most prominent Cabinet picks and appointees have been targeted by bomb threats and “swatting attacks," Trump's transition team said Wednesday.
articles.title: Trump transition says Cabinet picks, appointees were targeted by bomb threats, swatting attacks

articles.author: LOLITA C. BALDOR and FATIMA HUSSEIN
articles.description: WEST PALM BEACH, Fla. (AP) — President-elect Donald Trump said Wednesday that he has chosen Keith Kellogg, a highly decorated retired three-star general, to serve as his special envoy for Ukraine and Russia.
articles.title: Trump selects longtime adviser Keith Kellogg as special envoy for Ukraine and Russia

articles.author: BIANCA VÁZQUEZ TONESS
articles.description: Last time Donald Trump was president, rumors of immigration raids terrorized the Oregon community where Gustavo Balderas was the school superintendent.
articles.title: Schools are bracing for upheaval over fear of mass deportations

articles.author: JULIE CARR SMYTH and GEOFF MULVIHILL
articles.description: COLUMBUS, Ohio (AP) — Transgender students from kindergarten through college at Ohio public and private schools will be banned from using multiperson bathrooms that fit their gender identities under a measure that Republican Gov.
articles.title: Ohio governor signs bill limiting bathroom use by transgender students

articles.author: ERIC TUCKER, AAMER MADHANI and MATTHEW LEE
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Three American citizens imprisoned for years by China have been released and are returning to the United States, the White House said Wednesday, announcing a rare diplomatic agreement with Beijing in the final months of the Biden administration.
articles.title: 3 Americans held for years in China have been released, the White House says

articles.author: COLLEEN SLEVIN
articles.description: DENVER (AP) — Amid renewed interest in the killing of JonBenet Ramsey triggered in part by a new Netflix documentary, police in Boulder, Colorado, refuted assertions this week that there is viable evidence and leads about the 1996 killing of the 6-year-old girl that they are not pursuing.
articles.title: Police deny sitting on evidence as Netflix doc brings renewed attention to JonBenet Ramsey's killing

articles.author: AAMER MADHANI
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — President Joe Biden's administration is urging Ukraine to quickly increase the size of its military by drafting more troops and revamping its mobilization laws to allow for the conscription of those as young as 18.
articles.title: White House pressing Ukraine to draft 18-year-olds so it has enough troops to battle Russia

articles.author: ADITHI RAMAKRISHNAN
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Using fossilized feces and vomit samples from Poland, scientists have reconstructed how dinosaurs came to dominate the Earth millions of years ago.
articles.title: Fossilized dinosaur feces and vomit help scientists reconstruct the creatures' rise
